afghanistan.name: Afghanistan
afghanistan.description: The black colour refers to the dark past of the British Empire, the red represents the blood shed for independence and the green symbolises the hopeful Islamic future. The emblem in the centre consists of a mosque. The sheaves of wheat around the mosque represent fertility. The year 1298 (1919 in Gregorian calendar) is written under the mosque to refer to the year Afghanistan obtained control over its foreign affairs from the British Empire. Underneath the date, on a scroll, is the name “Afghanistan” written in Dari. Just above the mosque is written “Allahu Akbar” (God is Great), and above that are rays of sun leading up to the Islamic Declaration of Faith or “Shahada”: “There is no deity but God, and Mohammad is the messenger of God”.

albania.name: Albania
albania.description: The red colour in the background and the black eagle were inspired by the coat of arms of Gjergj Kastriot Skanderbeg, a leader Albanian that led a revolt against the ottoman empire in the fifteenth century.

algeria.name: Algeria
algeria.description: The column in green is a traditional representation of the belief of the Islamic state. The white means peace and honesty. The red crescent moon and star has its origin in pre-Islamic times and corresponds to Islam itself.

andorra.name: Andorra
andorra.description: This flag is compost of three colours. The junction of blue and red personifies the France´s banner, while the white and red were removed from the Spain´s emblem. The coat of arms in the middle holds a lot of meanings. The crown and the bat that appear in the first block allude to the bishop of Seu d’Urgell. The second and third frame refer to the county of ex-Foix and Catalonia. The last one is a figure of three cows, animals originating from Bearn.

angola.name: Angola
angola.description: The red means the sacrifices that the Angolans made for the autonomy of the country. The black colour illustrates the African continent. The yellow machete symbolizes the rural workers, while the half gear the industrial workers. The yellow star in the middle suggests the harmony of all the employees from the country. All these three figures make a reference to the older flag from Russia and the socialism.

antigua-and-barbuda.name: Antigua and Barbuda
antigua-and-barbuda.description: The red colour means power and blood of the former slaves, the sequence yellow-blue-white correlates to the Sun, the Caribbean Sea and the sand of the coast, respectively.

argentina.name: Argentina
argentina.description: The flag is compost for three colours: The blue represents the sky, the white express peace, harmony and clouds. The Sun in the central point is the May Sun, (Sol de Mayo in Spanish) and does a reference to the revolution that occurred in Argentina, in May.

armenia.name: Armenia
armenia.description: This flag is formed by three equal horizontal bands in the order red, blue and orange. The red colour connotes the courage and the struggle of the Armenian people. The blue refers to the sky and a peaceful life. And the white colour is the creativity and great energy.

australia.name: Australia
australia.description: The flag has three elements on a blue background: the Union Jack on the top left to represent British settlement; The Commonwealth Star which has seven points representing the unity of the six states and the territories of the Commonwealth of Australia; And the white Southern Cross is a reminder of the country's geography, since this contellation can only be seen in the southern hemisphere.

austria.name: Austria
austria.description: The meaning of the colours in the flag is quite ambiguous. Some people say that it comes from the time of the Crusaders, were the knights were covered in blood, except for the white belt.

azerbaijan.name: Azerbaijan
azerbaijan.description: The blue colour symbolizes the Turkish origin. The red bend is the modernization and progress and the green colour demonstrate the Islamic society. The white crescent moon also refers to the Islam.

bahamas.name: Bahamas
bahamas.description: The triangle at the base of the flag indicate the unity. The two strips in blue with the yellow strip in the middle propagates the view of the sea that bathes the country and its sands.

bahrain.name: Bahrain
bahrain.description: The flag is made by two colours: red and white. Red represents the Kharijite of Islam and the white colour indicates the confraternization and peace with the neighbouring countries.

bangladesh.name: Bangladesh
bangladesh.description: The green colour in the background refers to the flora local of the country. The red circle in the middle symbolizes the rising Sun. The colour by itself means the victims that died for Bangladesh.

barbados.name: Barbados
barbados.description: The flag is made up by three colours, blue, yellow and black. The two blue bands on both sides of the flag represents the ocean and the sky. The yellow colours personify the sand. And in the middle of the banner there is a tip of a black trident, meaning the independency of the United Kingdom.

belarus.name: Belarus
belarus.description: The red colour exemplifies the freedom and struggle that the Belarus people went through. The green means life and hope and the band red and white in the base of the flag does a reference to the Belarusian culture.

belgium.name: Belgium
belgium.description: This flag was inspired by the country’s coat of arms. The black colour represents the shield of the emblem. The yellow does a reference to a lion, a symbol of the country. The red symbolizes spears, lion’s claws and tongue.

belize.name: Belize
belize.description: The blue colour represents the reef and the red allude to the Mayas’ blood that the colonizers take advantage of. The figure in the middle is the country’s coat of arms. The mahogany tree connotes the beginning of the colony economy. Right below of the tree there is the country’s slogan “Sub umbra floreo” that means “In the shadow I prosper”.

benin.name: Benin
benin.description: There’s two interpretation of the flag. The first one is that it represents the African continent. In that case, the green symbolizes the palm trees, the yellow would be the savannas and the red would depict the ground. The other interpretation says that the green colour is hope and the rebirth of the nation. The yellow would express wealth and the red would represent the sacrifices made by the precursors of the nation.

bolivia.name: Bolivia
bolivia.description: The red colour is to honour those who fight for the republic. The yellow serve as a representation of Bolivia’s resources and the green band means hope and the beauty of the Bolivian flora. The image in the middle is the coat of arms of the country. The Andean Condor on top of it symbolizes a search for the new. The olive branch express peace, the laurel is glory, the axe is authority, the alpaca refers to the flora, the Sun shows the birth of Bolivia and the wheat means Bolivian’s food resources.

bosnia-and-herzegovina.name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
bosnia-and-herzegovina.description: The yellow triangle performs the image of the Bosnia and Herzegovina’s territory. Also, the three vertices of the polygon make mention of the three populations that make up the country: Croats, Servos e Bosnians. The white stars are a symbol to the European Union. The colours blue, yellow and white are associated with harmony and unity.

bostwana.name: Botswana
bostwana.description: The light blue represents the rainwater, that comes from the slogan of Botswana’s coat of arms: Rain and also good luck. The band in white-black-white indicates racial friendship. It still signifies the zebras in the emblem, a relevant animal for life in the country.

brazil.name: Brazil
brazil.description: The Brazil’s flag is composed by four colours. The green in the background illustrate the Brazilian’s forest. The yellow means all the resources and riches that the country has. The blue represents the rivers and skies and the white colour is the wish for peace. The little white stars personify all the states and the federal district. The slogan in the banner “Ordem e Progresso” means “Order and Progress”. The green and yellow colours can also be an allegory to the junction of the two royal families, Habsburg and Braganza.

brunei.name: Brunei
brunei.description: The yellow in the background refers to Brunei’s sultan. The diagonal white-black stripe alludes to Brunei’s top ministers. The red figure in the center is the coat of arms of the country. The hands connote obedience to government. The tape below is written “Brunei, the abode of peace”. The words on the crescent moon correspond: “Always in service with God’s guidance”. The winged pole symbolizes the monarchy.

bulgaria.name: Bulgaria
bulgaria.description: The flag is divided into three parts: The white band, which means peace, the green, that represents the fertile soil and the colour red that serve to demonstrate the fearlessness of these people. The colours white and red also allude to the past, where Bulgaria was part of Russia.

burkina-faso.name: Burkina Faso
burkina-faso.description: The colour red in the banner stands for the socialist revolution that happened. The green indicates the fertile soils of the country and the golden star in the middle symbolizes a guide to leading the country on a path of achievement and advancement.

burundi.name: Burundi
burundi.description: The flag is broken onto four parts by a white “X”. The parts on red stand for all the blood shed because of the effort to achieve country’s independence. The green colour symbolizes hope for a better future and the white means the spirit in harmony. The white circle in the middle whit three six-pointed stars have two possible meanings: The first is that the stars point out to the three ethnicities of Burundi, Hutus, Tutsis and Pygmies. The other one is that suggest the three components of government: Unity, Work and Progress.

cambodia.name: Cambodia
cambodia.description: The two blue bands above and below the flag mean all the beautiful flora of Cambodia. The red colour is about the heroes and victims that died in the country. The white temple in the center stands for spiritual harmony and peace.

cameroon.name: Cameroon
cameroon.description: The green band alludes to the south of the country. The red is a symbol for all the victims that died in the struggle for autonomy. The yellow colour is for the savannas in the north of Cameroon. The star in the middle represents unity.

canada.name: Canada
canada.description: The two red rectangles symbolize the oceans surrounding the country. The white square represents the Canadian territory and the maple leaf is a symbol of the country because it is very common to find your tree throughout your territory.

cape-verde.name: Cape Verde
cape-verde.description: The blue in the background appoint to the skies and seas. The lines in white and red is a representation of peace and determination, respectively, and it can also mean the story of creating a nation toward glory. The ten yellow stars illustrate the most important islands of Cape Verde.

central-african-republic.name: Central African Republic
central-african-republic.description: The colours blue, white and red in the flag refer to their former colonizer, France. The other colours, green, yellow and red are a pattern for the African people. The junction with these flags represents friendships and unity with the countries. The golden star in the upper left corner symbolizes the freedom and autonomy that the country has achieved.

chad.name: Chad
chad.description: The cobalt blue colour corresponds to the skies, the southern beaches of the country and can also serve as a representation of hope and ambition for the future. The yellow represents the Sun and sands, located in the north. The red part personifies the suffering that the country has gone through. More than that, the colour can mean unity and progress.

chile.name: Chile
chile.description: The bottom half of the flag expresses the sacrifices made by Chileans who gave their lives for their independence. The white illustrates the top of the Andes Mountains, a tourist spot of the country. The blue makes a reference to the Pacific Ocean that surrounds Chile and the sky. The star in the top left is a symbol for Chile’s political system.

china.name: China
china.description: The flag background in red is linked to socialism, but it is also a colour often used to represent grace, good luck and vitality. The biggest yellow star in the left corner could mean the Communist Party that rule China since the Chinese Revolution. The other little stars represent the social divisions of the Chinese population: Workers, farmers, rural and urban traders.

colombia.name: Colombia
colombia.description: The yellow refers to mineral resources that the country has. The blue alludes to the waters of the seas that bathe its coast and the red band emblematizes all the bloodshed to gain Colombia’s autonomy.

comoros.name: Comoros
comoros.description: The green triangle at the base of the flag along with the crescent moon expresses the Islamic belief. Each of the stars is a symbol of the four Comoros’ islands. The yellow stands for Mwali, the white represents Mayotte, red is for Anjouan and the blue colour act as Grande Comore.

cook-islands.name: Cook Islands
cook-islands.description: The flag is formed by red, blue and white. These three colours make a reference to the United Kingdom, these three colours make a reference to the United Kingdom, its former colonizer. The circle of stars illustrates the fifteen islands that make up the country.

costa-rica.name: Costa Rica
costa-rica.description: The two blue bands connote opportunity, perseverance and the skies. The white strip indicates wisdom, happiness and harmony. The red colour symbolizes all victims who lost their lives and family members because of the struggle for independence in the country. The coat of arms in the central band exemplify all the difficulties the country faced.

cote-divoire.name: Côte d Ivoire
cote-divoire.description: The orange stands for the savannas in the north and for the good soil in the country. The white colour means dignity and unity among the people of the country. The green is the wait for a better future.

croatia.name: Croatia
croatia.description: One of the translations of the flag is that the colours red, white and blue represent the three regions of the country. The other translation is that the colours have separate meanings: The blue illustrates the worship of God, the white transmits peace and the red personify the sacrifices made by the country. The shield in white and red represents the Croatian people.

cuba.name: Cuba
cuba.description: The red colour in the triangle illustrates the sacrifices made willingly by the motherland. The triangle itself personifies the motto of the French Revolution: Liberty, equality and fraternity. The white star in the centre shows the solidarity between the Cuban people. The three blue stripes symbolize the division of Cuba's former colony: West, centre and east. The white colour expresses the honour of the Cubans.

cyprus.name: Cyprus
cyprus.description: The white background stands for harmony and friendship. The colour copper yellow speaks for the country’s existing minerals. The figure in the middle is Cyprus’ territory. The olive branch below expresses the sense of harmony between the Greek and Turkish peoples.

czech-republic.name: Czech Republic
czech-republic.description: The blue triangle at the base of the flag represents the clear skies. The white band takes on the role of peace and unity and the red colour means the courage of the Czechs.

democratic-republic-of-the-congo.name: Democratic Republic of the Congo
democratic-republic-of-the-congo.description: The blue background exemplifies the peace. The two yellow diagonal bands represent the richness of the country. The red colour means the blood shed by the country. The yellow star in the upper left corner is a symbol for a better future and a harmony in the country.

denmark.name: Denmark
denmark.description: Denmark’s flag is formed by a white Nordic cross on a red background. The banner is probably derived from Lübeck's old coat of arms, which was red with a white cross and is one of the oldest flags in the world.

djibouti.name: Djibouti
djibouti.description: The white colour personifies peace. The blue and green colours represent, in this order, the seas and skies and the forests of the region. They can also mean the two ethnicities in Djibouti: Blue representing the Somali Issa ethnicity and green characterizing the Afar ethnicity.

dominica.name: Dominica
dominica.description: The green background alludes to the vast vegetation in the island. The three cross-shaped bands embody the Holy Trinity and each colour has a meaning. The yellow colour represents the natives, the black band is for the fertile soil and the white stand for the purity of the rivers. The red circle in the middle appears as justice. In the centre of the circle, there is a bird surrounded by ten stars. The bird is a symbol of the country because is a native species and is in danger of extinction. The stars are a representation of each parish church in the country.

dominican-republic.name: Dominican Republic
dominican-republic.description: The flag is divided into four pieces with the coat of arms in the centre. The parts in blue symbolize the skies. The red colour expresses the blood of the heroes that fight for the autonomy of the country. The white strips personify harmony among the population. The emblem in the flag has Christian symbols (the bible in the centre) but is possible to perceive pagan elements, like the laurel and palm branch. Slightly below of the figure is the name of the country and above it is written “Dios, Patria, Libertad” that means God, Motherland, Liberty”.

east-timor.name: East Timor
east-timor.description: The black triangle at the base represents the prejudice that needs to overcome. The yellow refers to East Timor’s former colonizer. The red color stands for the determination of the people and the fight for national liberty.

ecuador.name: Ecuador
ecuador.description: The yellow colour indicates mineral resources and fertile soil. The blue band connotes the oceans and the sky. The red expresses the sacrifices made by the people for freedom. The condor above the coat of arms represents power, greatness, and strength. The laurel branch and the palm leaf correspond to victory and the people who fight for liberty.

egypt.name: Egypt
egypt.description: The first red band expresses all the history of the country, that can also mean, in an unofficial read, the Egyptian deserts. The white symbolizes the Egyptian Revolution that happened in 1952. The colour black signifies the end of British colonialism and the beginning of a new era of liberty.

el-salvador.name: El Salvador
el-salvador.description: The two blue bands illustrate the two oceans that bathe Central America (the Pacific Ocean and the Atlantic Ocean) The white stripe is a representation of friendship and harmony. In the middle has the coat of arms. Inside of the triangle, above the five volcanoes, is written “15 Septiembre de 1821”, which is the date of El Salvador’s independence. A little higher there is a rainbow, expressing peace. Around the triangle is a laurel wreath, divided into 14 parts that indicate the states of the country. Circling everything there are the words “Republica de El Salvador en la America Central” which means: the Republic of El Salvador in Central America.

england.name: England
england.description: The red cross is a reference to the patron saint of England, St. George and the colour symbolize the fearlessness and all that was sacrificed for the country. The white background to England’s pureness.

equatorial-guinea.name: Equatorial Guinea
equatorial-guinea.description: The blue triangle illustrates the sea that surrounds the country and the islands in the territory. The green is a representation of the flora. The white stands for the harmony between the people. The red colour speaks for those who fight for freedom and independence. The coat of arms has a tree inside of a grey shield, six six-pointed stars right above and, little below of the tree, a strip where is written “Unidad, Paz, Justicia”. The tree denotes the local where was assigned the first treaty Equatorial Guinea has made with Spain. The stars illustrate the mainland and the other islands. The words below in the strip mean Unity, peace and justice.

eritrea.name: Eritrea
eritrea.description: The bigger triangle kind illustrates the territory of the country. The red represents the blood sherd for Eritrea’s independence. The green triangle on top means agriculture and livestock and the blue colour is an illustration of the red sea. The figure in the red triangle is composed of olive wreaths surrounding a vertical olive branch and embodies peace.

estonia.name: Estonia
estonia.description: The blue colour symbolizes the rivers, the sky and the sea. The black band in the middle connotes the fertile soil of the country and the white colour is associated with the hope and happiness of the population.

eswatini.name: Eswatini
eswatini.description: The two blue bands on top and bottom of the flag express the idea of peace and harmony. The bands in yellow right after represent the mineral resources and the red colour symbolizes all the conflict the country has gone through. The figure in the middle allude to the nation’s military traditions. It is painted in black and white to assume the role of the black and white people in the country that live tranquilly.

ethiopia.name: Ethiopia
ethiopia.description: The green band symbolizes the earth of the country. The yellow colour stands for hope for a prosperous future and the last band has the meaning of Ethiopia’s strength. The blue circle in the middle correspond to democracy’s power. The star inside of the circle signifies the friendship among the population of the country, while the five rays from the star suggest prosperity.

fiji.name: Fiji
fiji.description: The flag of Fiji is made of dark and light blue, white and red. In the top left corner in the banner, there is a representation of the United Kingdom’s flag. The light blue in the background illustrates the Pacific Ocean, that executes an important part of the economy. Leftmost there is a simpler version of Fiji’s coat of arms. The plants in the shield (a sugar cane, bananas and a coconut tree) represent the agriculture of the country. There is also a dove in the third square and symbolize peace.

finland.name: Finland
finland.description: Finland’s flag is constituted in two colours: white and blue. The white background personifies the snow and the blue imitate the rivers and the sky. The Nordic cross is a symbol commonly used to represent Christianity.

france.name: France
france.description: The flag is divided into three parts. The blue band together with the red and the white in the middle suggests the harmony of the monarchy and the people. The colour could still signify the motto of the French Revolution, “Liberté, Egalité, Fraternité” which means “Liberty, Equality, Fraternity.

french-guiana.name: French Guiana
french-guiana.description: The green in the flag imitates the forest beauty. The yellow colour acts in place of the riches and precious minerals of the country. The red five-pointed star in the middle illustrates the priority of the country, which would be the people always in the center.

gabon.name: Gabon
gabon.description: The green colour means the forests of the country. The yellow band imitates the sunlight and the blue alludes to the Atlantic Ocean that that bathes a part of the territory of Gabon.

gambia.name: Gambia
gambia.description: The red band at the top represents the Sun. The two white stripes symbolize peace and harmony. The blue colour is a representation of the Gambia river, one of the main rivers of Africa. The green band speaks for the forests and soil.

georgia.name: Georgia
georgia.description: The white background denominates purity. The red stands for the blood of those who fought for the country. The greater cross is a symbol of Christianity and divides the flag into four parts, each with a smaller templar cross.

germany.name: Germany
germany.description: Unlike the other banners, the Germany flag colours cannot be interpreted individually. The colours black, red and yellow colours mean the conquered democracy and the liberty of the population.

ghana.name: Ghana
ghana.description: The red stands for the blood of those who fought for freedom. The yellow represents the mineral resources that the country has and the green colour symbolizes Ghana’s flora. The five-pointed black star is a symbol of when the country had its autonomy resumed.

granada.name: Granada
granada.description: The red symbolizes bravery and energy. The gold-yellow represents the wisdom and the green colour illustrates the diverse flora of Granada and its agriculture. The six yellow five-pointed stars in the red outline allude to six parishes in the country and the star in the middle is a symbol for the capital, St. George. The figure leftmost in the green triangle correspond to a nutmeg, a very important seed in the country.

greece.name: Greece
greece.description: The blue bands are a representation of the seas and the sky while the white one symbolizes the seafoam and the clouds. The white cross is a symbol of Catholicism. The nine lines allude to the motto used in the fight for independence “Freedom or death”, that has nine syllables in Greek.

greenland.name: Greenland
greenland.description: The white band on top means the ice that covers almost the whole territory. The red colours stand for the seas that bathe the island. The red half circle act as the Sun and the other white half the icebergs. The two halves can also illustrate the Sun reflected in the water.

guatemala.name: Guatemala
guatemala.description: The two blue parts serve as the oceans around the territory (the Pacific Ocean and the Atlantic Ocean). The white band symbolizes the harmony and honorable values of the people. The coat of arms in the center has two intersecting rifles that represent the desire to fight for the country. Inside the scroll is written “Libertad, 15 de Septiembre de 1821” which means “Liberty September 15, 1821” which is the data of the Central America independence of Spain. The laurel wreath is a Greek symbol of victory.

guinea.name: Guinea
guinea.description: The red stands for the blood of those who fought for the autonomy of the country. The yellow part in the middle represents the precious mineral reserves in the soil and the energy of the Sun. The green colour illustrates the vegetation of the country.

guinea-bissau.name: Guinea-Bissau
guinea-bissau.description: The vertical red band is to honor those who fight for freedom. The yellow colour speaks for the Sun and the richness of the soil that contains plenty of precious minerals. The green band expresses the hope of the people for a better future.

guyana.name: Guyana
guyana.description: The triangle red represents the nation. The black outline symbolizes the strength of the people to any problem. The yellow stands for a large number of mineral resources. The white colour illustrates the waters of the rivers and the two green triangles connote agriculture and nature.

haiti.name: Haiti
haiti.description: The flag of Haiti was inspired by France’s flag, but without the white colour and with horizontal stripes. Separately, the blue means honesty and loyalty and the red colours stand for determination and power. The blue and the red together represent the pacific coexistence between blacks and mulattos. The main elements of the coat of arms is a palm tree and the two cannons. The hood on the palm tree illustrates the independence and the cannons express the willingness to fight of the people.

honduras.name: Honduras
honduras.description: The two light blue bands denote the Pacific Ocean and the Caribbean Sea. The white colour represents the territory of the country in the middle. The five blue five-pointed stars symbolize an old country that brought together Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras and Nicaragua. The stars show the desire to attach these countries as before.

hong-kong.name: Hong Kong
hong-kong.description: The red background represents China, the country in which Hong Kong is under domination, but still controls its administration. The red can also represent festivals, where red is often used to show good feelings. The white flower symbolizes the country in a demonstration that Hong Kong still belongs to itself.

hungary.name: Hungary
hungary.description: The red band on top symbolizes power and determination. The white colour represents expresses integrity and trustworthiness. The green band corresponds to people's expectations for a better quality of life.

iceland.name: Iceland
iceland.description: The blue background illustrates the sky and the seas. The white outline represents the continuous snow seasons over short periods of time. The red colour refers to the island volcanoes that formed the territory. The Scandinavian cross it's a Viking symbol.

india.name: India
india.description: The saffron colour on top stands for fearlessness, sacrifice and integrity. The white band symbolizes sincerity and pureness. The green on bottom personifies faith, fertility and hope. The blue figure in the center has a lot of spiritual meanings, but in agreement with the philosopher Sarvepali Radhakrishnan, it symbolizes truth and virtue to advance.

indonesia.name: Indonesia
indonesia.description: The red colour on top represents the bravery people that fight for freedom. The white band below signifies pureness and spiritual harmony. The origin of the flag is uncertain. Some people think the colours are derived from Austronesian mythology with red representing the earth and white to the sky. Others say that the red came from the earliest dyes and the white is from the natural colour of woven cloths. Others say that red symbolizes the first dyes and white came from the primary colour of the fabrics of the time.

iran.name: Iran
iran.description: The green band indicates the harmony, the flora and the Persian idiom. The white stands for liberty and the colour red are used to honor all those who fought for the country. The white patterns in the first and last track form the phrase “Allahu akbar”, which means:  God is greatness. This phrase is written eleven times on both sides and corresponds to the date 11th of February 1979, the birth of the Islamic Republic.

iraq.name: Iraq
iraq.description: The red band stands for the people who sacrifice themselves to the country’s autonomy. The white symbolizes the morale of the Iraqis and their purity. The black colour represents the people's resistance to adversity. The green words in the centre mean “God is great”. The green is often used to indicate Islam.

ireland.name: Ireland
ireland.description: The green colour represents the Irish republic and the Gaelic tradition. The orange stripe on the left stands for the Protestant supporters of William III, who was of the house of Orange. The white band in the middle expresses the harmony between the two groups.

israel.name: Israel
israel.description: The two blue bands represent the grandeur of the country and the white colour means radiance. These two colours are meant to imitate the Tallit, the traditional Jewish prayer shawl. The six-pointed blue star is the Star of David, is a symbol of Judaism.

italy.name: Italy
italy.description: The green colour symbolizes the reliefs of the country. The white band represents the glacial masses in the north of the country and the red stands for those who fight for liberty. There is also another meaning for colours, with green for hope, white for faith, and red for kindness.

jamaica.name: Jamaica
jamaica.description: The two black side triangles illustrate the population and its strength and courage. The two yellow stripes represent the Sun, that in the culture symbolize harmony and hope. The green colour illustrates the beauty of the flora and the richness of the country's soil.

japan.name: Japan
japan.description: Japan’s flag is composed of a white banner with a red circle in the centre. The white colour represents pureness and the red stands for devotion. The circle in the middle symbolizes the rising Sun, as well as one of its most important deities, the Sun goddess Amaterasu.

jordan.name: Jordan
jordan.description: The red triangle represents the Hashemite kingdom that controls the country. The colours black, white and green symbolize, respectively, the Abbasid, Umayyad and Fatimid caliphs. The seven-pointed white star in the triangle express unity, but can also mean the seven verses of the first sura in the Quran or the seven mountains where the capital was founded.

kazakhstan.name: Kazakhstan
kazakhstan.description: The light blue refers to the Turkish people and to the emotions of integrity and loyalty. The yellow colour makes a reference to the Genghis Khan empire. The Sun on the center alludes to life’s energy and abundance. The eagle below symbolizes the country’s authority and kindness. The pattern at the base of the flag represents Kazakh culture.

kenya.name: Kenya
kenya.description: The black band represents the majority of the population that is black. The white strips express harmony and peace. The red stands for the blood of those who fought for the country. The green colour personifies the earth. The shield in the centre of the flag symbolizes the unbeatable defence.

kiribati.name: Kiribati
kiribati.description: The flag is formed by blue, yellow, white and red. The waves in blue illustrate the Pacific Ocean. The white colour symbolizes the Line Islands, Phoenix and Gilbert regions. The yellow Sun in the middle has seventeen rays, which refer to the main islands that composed the country. The frigate bird above the Sun corresponds to sea power and freedom.

kosovo.name: Kosovo
kosovo.description: The colours in Kosovo’s banner were inspired by the European Union’s flag. The image in the middle is an illustration of the country’s territory. The six white five-pointed stars represent the six ethnics that predominate in the country: Albanians, Serbs, Turks, Gorans, Rom, and Bosnians.

kuwait.name: Kuwait
kuwait.description: The meaning of the colours in the flag comes from a poem written in the 13th century by Safie Al-Deen Al-Hali. The green personifies the fields. The white colour illustrates purity and harmony. The red stand for the blood of those who fight for the freedom and the black trapeze represents the struggle that the country went through.

kyrgystan.name: Kyrgyzstan
kyrgystan.description: The red background symbolizes the fearlessness and morality of the people. The engraving in the Sun represents the upper crossbar of the nomad housing structure. The forty rays correspond to the forty tribes that composed the country. The whole Sun in the flag personifies harmony and success.

laos.name: Laos
laos.description: The two upper and lower red bands stand for the blood of those who fought for autonomy. The blue colour symbolizes the richness of the country and the Mekong river, which is the most important river of the country. The circle illustrates the full moon and the harmony between the people who live there.

latvia.name: Latvia
latvia.description: The two red bands and the white band on the flag originate from a legend in which it says that a Latvian hero died in the fight and when it was wrapped in a shroud, space was left blank. The Latvian used the cloth as a banner and won the battle in the next day.

lebanon.name: Lebanon
lebanon.description: The two red bands represent the sacrifices made for the independence of the country. The white stands for snow and purity. The green Lebanon cedar tree in the middle is a symbol of longevity, peace and nationalism since the tree is pretty common in the country.

lesotho.name: Lesotho
lesotho.description: The blue connotes the sky and rain. The white colour in the middle symbolizes harmony and peace and the green corresponds to the success of the country. The image in the center illustrates the Mokorotlo hat, that represents the Basotho people.

liberia.name: Liberia
liberia.description: The red stripes symbolize the Liberians' determination when facing their enemies. The white represents morality and honor. The blue square denotes the Liberian territory and the white star inside the square acts as a symbol for the freedom conquered of the former slaves.

libya.name: Libya
libya.description: The red stands for the blood of those who fought for the country’s independence. The black alludes to the dark past of the country and the green colour symbolize prosperity, success and wealth. The white crescent moon with the star is a symbol of Islam.

liechtenstein.name: Liechtenstein
liechtenstein.description: The blue band is an illustration of the skies and the red band on the bottom of the flag symbolizes the evening fires that were lit inside the houses. The golden crown on top represents the monarchy and the harmony among their people.

lithuania.name: Lithuania
lithuania.description: The yellow colour corresponds to richness and Sun’s energy. The green in the middle symbolizes the emotions of hope and free will, but can also represent Lithuania’s flora. The red stands for the sacrifices made by the martyrs for freedom and their bravery.

luxembourg.name: Luxembourg
luxembourg.description: The colours in the banner were inspired by the coat of arms of the country and France’s flag. The red stands for the courage and strength of their people and their territory. The white mean peace and the blue colour symbolize the sky.

macau.name: Macau
macau.description: The five stars above the white lotus flower refer to China. The three petals of the blooming lotus flower represent the Macao Peninsula and the islands of Taipa and Colane and prosperity. The bridge and the water under the flower are an illustration of Macao’s fauna and flora.

madagascar.name: Madagascar
madagascar.description: The white band symbolizes the rice, an essential product for the economy and agriculture. The red stands for the blood of those who fought for the country. The green colour represents the harmony between the Malagasy and nature and the peasants who fought for their autonomy.

malawi.name: Malawi
malawi.description: The black band corresponds to the country’s population. The red symbolizes all the martyrs that sacrifice themselves to the country. The green colour represents the beauty of Malawian flora. The red sun at the top is a symbol of new possibilities for the future and can also refer to the name of the country, which came from the effect made on Niassa Lake.

malaysia.name: Malaysia
malaysia.description: The fourteen stripes, along with the yellow fourteen-pointed star are an illustration of the thirteen states plus the Malaysian Federation. The crescent moon is a symbol of Islam. The blue rectangle means the harmony among the people and the yellow represents the Malaysian royalty.

maldives.name: Maldives
maldives.description: The green rectangle connotes harmony and success. The red outline stands for the people who fought for the country’s freedom and their fearlessness. The white crescent moon symbolizes the Islamic religion.

mali.name: Mali
mali.description: The green band alludes to the fertile soil, as well as the flora of the country. The yellow symbolizes the mineral abundance in the land. The red means the bloodshed for Mali’s autonomy.

malta.name: Malta
malta.description: The meaning of the red and white colours is uncertain, but most people accept that it came from the old flag of the Knights of Malta. George Cross was added in 1943 as a decoration for its acts in World War II.

marshall-islands.name: Marshall Islands
marshall-islands.description: The flag is formed by the colours blue, white and orange. The blue background is cut by two diagonal stripes. The orange one represents the rising sun and the white strip symbolizes the sun itself. The twenty-four point of the star refers to the districts of the country while the four largest points represent Wotje, Jaluit, Ebeye, and Majuro, which are the main urban centers.

mauritania.name: Mauritania
mauritania.description: The green in the background alludes to the Islamic religion. The yellow colour represents the sand of the Sahara deserts. The yellow crescent moon with the star above is a symbol of Islam.

mauritius.name: Mauritius
mauritius.description: The red colour at the top stands for the adversities that the country went through for autonomy. The blue band symbolizes the Indian Ocean and the yellow is the sunlight, but it could also be translated as freedom. The green stripe at the bottom corresponds to Mauritius’ vegetation.

mexico.name: Mexico
mexico.description: The colours of the Mexican flag haven't an official meaning, but the majority accept that the green band alludes to the feeling of hope, the white symbolize harmony between the people and the red stands for the sacrifices made by the martyrs in the war. The coat of arms in the middle is composed of an eagle biting a snake above a cactus in a river with laurel and oak branches in both sides. The coat of arms came from an Aztec legend.

micronesia.name: Micronesia
micronesia.description: The light blue background assumes the role of the Pacific Ocean and the four white five-pointed stars represent the four main parts of the territory: Kosrae, Yap, Chuuk and Pohnpei.

moldova.name: Moldova
moldova.description: The Moldovan flag colours don't have specific meaning as it was inspired by the Romanian flag, but some people may say that the colours represent Liberty, justice and fraternity. The flag also has the coat of arms in the middle.

monaco.name: Monaco
monaco.description: The red band on top stands for the human body and the white strip below appears as a representation of spiritual harmony and peace. These two colours together personify the Grimaldi House, the family that founded the Monaco country.

mongolia.name: Mongolia
mongolia.description: The two red bands represent harmony and advancement. The blue colour is an illustration of the sky. The figure in the left band is the Soyombo that, in general, means: Success, eternity, honesty, strength and harmony.

montenegro.name: Montenegro
montenegro.description: The flag has two colours and the country's coat of arms. The colours (red and gold) represent the people of Montenegro. The coat of arms in the middle is composed of a golden two-headed eagle represent a harmony between government and clergy. In its claws is an orb and a sceptre that, together with the crown allude to the Petrović-Njegoš dynasty. The shield in the eagle’s chest corresponds to the “Lion of Judas”.

morocco.name: Morocco
morocco.description: The red background stands for the brave Moroccan people and the followers of the prophet Muhammad. The green five-pointed star symbolizes Solomon's seal. The green colour on the star is a classic symbol of the Islamic religion.

mozambique.name: Mozambique
mozambique.description: The red triangle at the base symbolizes the struggles that the people and the country have gone through. The green colour alludes to Mozambique's vegetation. The black represents the African population and the yellow colour stands for the abundance of riches in the soil. The book, the hoe and the firearm acts as, respectively, wisdom, work and defense.

myanmar.name: Myanmar
myanmar.description: The yellow colour expresses the desire for peace and harmony that is within the people. The green corresponds to the solidarity of the country. The red band symbolizes bravery and the misfortunes the country faced. The white five-pointed star in the center exhibits the union achieved among the ancient regions of the country.

namibia.name: Namibia
namibia.description: The blue triangle is an illustration of the sky and the Atlantic Ocean. The red colour represents the determined and strong people of Namibia. The two diagonal white stripes stand for friendship and harmony. The green alludes to the flora and soil resources. The sun in the blue triangle symbolizes energy and life.

nauru.name: Nauru
nauru.description: The blue background illustrates the Pacific Ocean. The yellow stripe in the middle symbolizes the equator line. The twelve-pointed white star exhibits the location of the country on the Pacific Ocean. The points of the star personify the twelve Indian tribes that formed the country.

nepal.name: Nepal
nepal.description: The flag of Nepal is made up of two triangles one above the other in blue and crimson with two white figures. The dark blue outline represents harmony and friendship and the crimson colour correspond to the national flower, rhododendron and to the courage of the people. The figures in the flag stand for purity, hope, longevity and the temperature extremes

netherlands.name: Netherlands
netherlands.description: The colours white, blue and orange were chosen to represent Guilherme de Orange's uniform, a leader of the Dutch independence struggle in the time. The orange on the flag was an unstable colour and turned to red over time, so it was preferable to officially switch to this colour.

new-caledonia.name: New Caledonia
new-caledonia.description: The blue illustrates the sky and the Pacific Ocean. The red stands for the bloodshed and the victims who died in the battles for autonomy and freedom. The green colour alludes to New Caledonia itself. The yellow circle personifies the sun. The figure in the middle is a flèche faitière; a dart that the natives threw at the roofs of the tutus' houses.

new-zealand.name: New Zealand
new-zealand.description: The flag is formed by white, red and blue. In the top left corner in the banner, there is a representation of the United Kingdom’s flag. The blue background illustrates the water and sky surrounding the territory and the four red stars symbolizes the Southern Cross, indicating the location of New Zealand.

nicaragua.name: Nicaragua
nicaragua.description: The two blue bands represent the two oceans that bathe the country, the Pacific Ocean and the Atlantic Ocean. The white band symbolizes peace. The triangle in the center stands for equality, the red hood corresponds to freedom and independence, the rainbow connotes harmony and the five volcanos reproduce the friendships between the countries of Central America. The letter around the triangle translated is “Republic of Nicaragua, Central America.”

niger.name: Niger
niger.description: The orange band on top corresponds to the Sahara Desert. The white in the middle symbolizes harmony and pureness of the country and the green colour stands for the hope and the fertile soils in the south. The orange circle represents the sun.

nigeria.name: Nigeria
nigeria.description: The two green bands on the left and right of the flag appear as an illustration of the richness and fertility of the country's soil. The white colour in the centre stands for harmony, friendship and peace among the people and the country.

niue.name: Niue
niue.description: The yellow background alludes to the good relationship that the country has with New Zealand. In the top left corner in the banner, there is a representation of the United Kingdom’s flag with some modifications to indicate New Zealand as well, such as the five yellow stars representing the Southern Cross. The bigger star also stands for the independence gained.

north-korea.name: North Korea
north-korea.description: The blue colour acts as harmony and peace and the red band in the middle represent socialism. The combination of blue, white and red are traditional colours in the country. The red five-pointed star also symbolizes socialism and the white circle alludes to the symbol of Yin and Yang.

north-macedonia.name: North Macedonia
north-macedonia.description: The flag of North Macedonia has many controversies. When the country gained independence in 1991, they adopted a red-bottomed flag with the Virginia sun in the middle. The symbol mainly displeased Greece and Albania, saying that the figure was several times in Greek culture and only recognized the Macedonians. In 1995, they change the Virginia sun with the new sun of freedom in their anthem.

norway.name: Norway
norway.description: The Norwegian flag uses the colours white, red and blue, used in flags that conveyed the feeling of freedom in the 19th century, such as the United States and France. The white and blue Nordic cross is a symbol of Christianity.

oman.name: Oman
oman.description: The white band on top symbolizes prosperity and harmony. The red illustrates the Green Mountains and the flora in the country. The red stands for all the people who sacrifice themselves to freedom. The coat of arms in the upper left refers to attack and defend and also the culture of the country.

pakistan.name: Pakistan
pakistan.description: The green square represents the Muslim part of the population and the Islamism, while the white band alludes to the minority and the harmony between them. The white crescent moon is a symbol of the Islamic and the five-pointed star above stands for progress and wisdom.

palau.name: Palau
palau.description: The light blue background on the banner represents the independence gained after Japan took control of the country. The leftmost yellow disc illustrates the full moon and symbolizes harmony and friendship, as well as the optimum time for human activity.

panama.name: Panama
panama.description: The blue square alludes to the conservative party while the red square refers to the liberal party. The blue star corresponds to sincerity and pureness and the red star stands for the sovereignty and the laws. The blank parts represent harmony and friendship.

papua-new-guinea.name: Papua New Guinea
papua-new-guinea.description: The flag is divided into two triangles. The red triangle has the Raggiana bird of paradise, which is the national bird. In the black part of the flag is Cruzeiro do Sul, a constellation seen in the southern hemisphere. The colours black and red are customary colours of the tribes of the country.

paraguay.name: Paraguay
paraguay.description: The red band symbolizes equality before the law. The white colour represents harmony and the blue stands for free will. In the middle is the coat of arms of the country and on the other side of the flag is the seal of the treasury. The emblem has a yellow star, that alludes to the day of independence, a palm and olive branch meaning honor and peace. The seal has a Phrygian cap symbolizing freedom and a golden lion representing the defender of freedom.

peru.name: Peru
peru.description: The flag is formed by two red bands with a white stripe in the middle. The red alludes to the Inca and Spanish origin of the population. The white colour in the center represents equality, harmony between the people and pureness.

philippines.name: Philippines
philippines.description: The white triangle at the base of the flag stands for equality. The three yellow five-pointed stars represent the mains islands: Visayas, Mindanao and Luzon. The eight rays in the sun refer to the eight provinces that fought against Spain for autonomy. The blue band on top symbolizes honesty and the colour red corresponds to the courage.

poland.name: Poland
poland.description: The flag is divided into two equal parts. The red and white came from the origin of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth. The white alludes to unity and the white eagle, which came from a legend that goes back to the discovery of the lands of the country. The red stands for the martyrs that died for liberty.

portugal.name: Portugal
portugal.description: The green part symbolizes hope and the red stands for those who sacrifice themselves for the freedom of the country. The dividing line of colours is an armillary sphere and the Portuguese shield. is an astronomical tool that worked like a compass and was essential in the times of the Great Navigations. The Portuguese shield dates to the "Miracle of Ouriques" where Jesus predicted his victory over the five kings, and as a tribute was used the five shields forming a cross. The seven yellow castles represent the seven strongholds conquered by King Afonso III.

puerto-rico.name: Puerto Rico
puerto-rico.description: The blue triangle symbolizes the government of Puerto Rico and the white five-pointed star in the centre of the triangle represents the free state of the country. The three reed bands allude to the legislative, executive and judiciary powers and the people who died for their freedom. The two white stripes correspond to human rights and their free will.

qatar.name: Qatar
qatar.description: The flag is separated into two parts by a zigzag line. The white in the left symbolizes harmony and peace and the Qatar red corresponds to the importance of purple and maroon dyes in the history of the country and stands for the royal household of Qatar and the Emir. The nine white triangles allude to the ninth country of the Emirates to reconcile after the British Treaty in 1916.

republic-of-the-congo.name: Republic of the Congo
republic-of-the-congo.description: The light blue in the background represents harmony among the people. The diagonal red band stands for those who fought for free will and the yellow stripes correspond to the richness that can be found in the country. The yellow five-pointed star in the upper left corner symbolizes the country's promising future.

romania.name: Romania
romania.description: The flag is composed of three colours: Blue, yellow and red. Each colour has two different meanings. The blue part symbolizes freedom and the Transylvanian region, the yellow represents justice and the region of Wallachia and the red colour comes from the Moldavian flag and stands for friendship.

russia.name: Russia
russia.description: Although there is no official meaning, the population gives the following symbolization to colours: Sincerity and nobility for white, bravery and love for red and impeccability, faithfulness and honesty for blue.

rwanda.name: Rwanda
rwanda.description: The light blue on the flag alludes to the harmony and bliss of the people. The yellow stripe stands for economic breakthrough and the green colour represent hope for a better future. The yellow sun on the blue part corresponds to enlightenment and wisdom for the future.

saint-kitts-and-nevis.name: Saint Kitts and Nevis
saint-kitts-and-nevis.description: The flag is divided into two triangles and a diagonal stripe in the middle. The green triangle above is a representation of the fertile soil in the country. The red triangle symbolizes resistance against colonization. The two yellow stripes stand for the sun, very present in the country and its culture. The black diagonal band alludes to the African roots of the country and the people. The two white stars in the middle correspond to the feelings of hope and freedom.

saint-lucia.name: Saint Lucia
saint-lucia.description: The flag is composed of a light blue background, with three triangles superimposed on each other. The yellow alludes to the progress. The colours black and white represent the mix of ethnicities in the country and the light blue corresponds to integrity. The triangles represent the people's faith and longing.

saint-vincent-and-the-grenadines.name: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
saint-vincent-and-the-grenadines.description: The blue band on the left personifies the sea and the skies. The yellow in the middle acts as the golden sand and as the happiness of the country. The green colour symbolizes the country's flora and liveliness. The "V" shaped diamonds allude to the country's name and compare its islands with jewels.

samoa.name: Samoa
samoa.description: The red background on the flag corresponds to the bravery of the people in the country. The blue square in the upper left expresses the feeling of freedom. The white stars act as the Southern Cross constellation, which can only be seen in the southern hemisphere.

san-marino.name: San Marino
san-marino.description: The country flag is formed by two horizontal stripes: white and blue. The white stripe represents the snow at the top of Mount Titano (the place with the highest altitude in the country) and the colour blue below represents the sky. In the center is the coat of arms, with the words "Liberta", which means freedom in Latin

sao-tome-and-principe.name: São Tomé and Príncipe
sao-tome-and-principe.description: The flag is separated into three parts with a triangle at the base. The red triangle symbolizes the martyrs who sacrifice themselves for the freedom of the country. The yellow, red and green are the pan-African colours. The two black stars represent the reconciliation between the whole country.

saudi-arabia.name: Saudi Arabia
saudi-arabia.description: The banner consists of two colours: green and white. The green covering the entire bottom of the flag symbolizes the Islamic religion. In the middle is Shahada, one of the five pillars of Islam and means: “There is no god but Allah, and Muhammad is his messenger”. The sword below expresses victory, harmony and impartiality among the country.

scotland.name: Scotland
scotland.description: The white cross represents Saint Andrew, the patron of the country, while the blue background symbolizes the sky. The construction of the flag originated from an 8th-century legend. In a battle against the Anglo-Saxons, the Scots were surrounded, and their leader prayed for victory. That same night, Saint Andrew appeared and guaranteed victory in the fight and the next day clouds formed in the sky in the shape of a cross, motivating the Scots.

senegal.name: Senegal
senegal.description: The flag consists of three equal strips with the colours green, yellow and red. In addition to being pan-African colours, each has a different meaning. The green express faith. The yellow stands for wealth, wisdom and creativity and the red colour denotes the fearlessness and the will to fight of the citizens.

serbia.name: Serbia
serbia.description: The flag is divided into 3 parts with the combination of colours blue, white and red. The colours themselves do not have a meaning of their own, apart from being Pan-Slavic colours. The crown on the leftmost coat of arms refers to imperial time. although the country is democratic. The double-headed eagle alludes to the Nemean dynasty.

seychelles.name: Seychelles
seychelles.description: The shapes of the strips indicate an advanced country facing the future. The flag is made of five colours. The blue stands for the sky and the seas that surrounded the country. The yellow strip corresponds to the energy of life and the sun. The red colour represents the will and unity of the people to work for a better future with equality. The white one means peace and fairness. The green colour symbolizes the flora and its soil and fertility.

sierra-leone.name: Sierra Leone
sierra-leone.description: The banner is composed of three colours: light green, white and blue. The light green represents the variety of the country's flora. The white colour corresponds to the desire for justice and harmony. The blue strip acts as the waters of the port of Sierra Leone's capital, Freetown and connotes hope.

singapore.name: Singapore
singapore.description: In the top half, there is a white crescent moon and a circle of five white stars on a red background and the other half is completely white. The crescent moon connotes to the progress of a developing nation and the stars represent the five pillars of the country: egalitarianism, harmony, equality, progress and honesty. The red colour stands for the will of the people and their bravery and the white symbolize pureness and peace.

slovakia.name: Slovakia
slovakia.description: The flag is divided into three-band with the Pan-Slavic colours: white, blue and red. The coat of arms is further to the left on the central strip. The white double cross-refers to the rebirth of Jesus.

slovenia.name: Slovenia
slovenia.description: The white, blue and red are the Pan-Slavic colours that most Slavic countries use on their flags. On the coat of arms, you can see three white mountains, three yellow six-pointed stars and water at the bottom. The mountains denote the Mount Triglav, the highest point in the country. The three stars originated from the emblem of the Slovenian Celje dynasty (between the 14th and 15th centuries). The water below the mountains stand for the Adriatic Sea.

solomon-islands.name: Solomon Islands
solomon-islands.description: The flag is divided into two parts with a yellow strip dividing diagonally. The up part has five white stars in a blue background. The stars represent the five most populous regions of the country and the blue background connotes the sky. The green colour symbolizes the ground. The yellow stripe alludes to the sun's rays touching the sky and the earth.

somalia.name: Somalia
somalia.description: The light blue background is a reference to the UN flag, which helped the country a lot in the independence process. The five white five-pointed stars in the shape of a circle in the middle of the flag refer to the five regions inhabited by Somalis.

south-africa.name: South Africa
south-africa.description: The flag has six colours: red, white, green, yellow, black and blue. The first colour, from top to bottom, connotes the sacrifice made by the people's country. The green "Y" shape band symbolizes the land rich in vegetation and its shape alludes to the unity of the people after a time of segregation and the blue denotes the sky. The black and white colours refer to the country's population. The yellow outline represents gold, a mineral widely found in its lands.

south-korea.name: South Korea
south-korea.description: The red and blue circle in the center, that is originated from the Yin Yang symbol, represent the infinite and perfection. The risks around the circle are trigrams and each of them has several meanings and a proper name. The upper left trigram is called Gam, a symbol of water, lunar, connected to the north, wisdom and winter. The upper right trigram is called Geon, a symbol of the heavens, to the east, justice, humans and spring. The lower right trigram is called Ri. Their meanings are solar energy, the autumn season, to the south, achievements and fire. The last one is in the lower left and its name is Gon. This symbol stands for sympathy, earth, to the summer and to the west. The white background connotes the immaculacy of its population.

south-sudan.name: South Sudan
south-sudan.description: The green triangle at the bottom of the banner is a symbol of Islamic religion, farming and success. Red means the blood of those who fight for the country, socialism and the rejection of colonialism. The white colour corresponds to the feeling of immaculateness and happiness. The last band alludes to the meaning of the name of the country since in Arabic, Sudan means black and to the revolution of Mahdi.

spain.name: Spain
spain.description: The flag has two red stripes and a yellow band in the middle with the coat left most. The red colour personifies the deaths of the people who sacrifice themselves for the country and for bravery. The yellow represents material goods. The coat of arms refers to Spain's past. The shields inside the coat of arms are from several kingdoms that came together to form the country. Above the larger shield, there is the crown, which refers to both dominion and royalty. The cross on top of the crown is a symbol of Christianity.

sri-lanka.name: Sri Lanka
sri-lanka.description: The flag is divided into two rectangles. The first one is separated in two colours: green and orange. The green band represents the Muslims and orange corresponds to the Tamils. The golden outline refers to the unity between all religions in the country. The four leaves symbolize the four foundations of Buddhism: impartiality, happiness, benevolence and solidarity. The golden lion is a symbol of the Sinhalese ethnicity and the fearlessness of their people and his sword stands for the potency of the country.

sudan.name: Sudan
sudan.description: The green triangle at the base of the flag is a symbol of the Islamic religion. The colour red represents the people who sacrificed themselves for the freedom and morals of the country. The white band stands for harmony, light and happiness of the people. The last colour refers to the name of the country because, in Arabic, Sudan means "black"

suriname.name: Suriname
suriname.description: The flag is formed in four colours: green, white, red and yellow. The two green bands personify the feeling of expectation and fertility. The white stripes stand for justice and unity and the colour red corresponds to the love and development of the country. The yellow star in the middle symbolizes the harmony among all ethnic groups.

sweden.name: Sweden
sweden.description: The banner is composed of two colours: blue in the background and yellow on the cross. There are some theories about the origin of the flag. The most accepted is that the colours are derived from the country's coat of arms. Although Sweden is considered one of the least religious countries in the world, the cross-refers to the enormous expressiveness of those who designate themselves as Christians.

switzerland.name: Switzerland
switzerland.description: One of the theories of the origin of the flag may have come from the Battle of Laupen in 1339. The soldiers sewed white crosses on their uniforms to differentiate themselves. After that, the white cross started to appear in arms and shields.

syria.name: Syria
syria.description: The flag is separated into three equal bands, with two green stars in the centre. The red stands for the martyrs that died for the freedom and alludes to the Hexamite dynasty. White corresponds to the Umayyad dynasty. The last colour connotes to the Abbasid Caliphate. The green colour in the stars represents the Islamic religion.

taiwan.name: Taiwan
taiwan.description: The red background stands for those who sacrifice themselves for the country and for the life provided by the soil. The blue square expresses the feeling of freedom and denotes the skies. The white colour in the sun has the meaning of popular government and justice. The twelve rays of the sun symbolize the months.

tajikistan.name: Tajikistan
tajikistan.description: The flag is separated into three equal bands white three different colours: red, white and green. Red stands for the harmony of the country. The white colours illustrate the cotton and the green band denotes the beauty of nature.

tanzania.name: Tanzania
tanzania.description: The flag is divided diagonally by a black band with a yellow outline. The colours in the two halves, green and blue, respectively represent the great diversity of flora and a large number of lakes in the territory. The black on the dividing line is a representation of Tanzania’s population. The yellow exhibits the richness of the soil. All the colours together allude to the unity between Tanganyika and Zanzibar, two regions that now form a country.

thailand.name: Thailand
thailand.description: The flag is composed of five bands and the tree Pan-Slavic colours: blue, red and white. The red band is a reference about the country patriotism and their fight. The blue is considered the national colour of the country. The white colour stands for faith, harmony and pureness.

togo.name: Togo
togo.description: The yellow bands act as the dedication of the results of the work. The green colour expresses the feeling of hope in the farming of the country. The red square represents honesty, friendship, love and wisdom. The white star in the square assumes the role of purity.

tonga.name: Tonga
tonga.description: The flag is formed by a red background and a white square on the upper left with a centered red cross. The red represents the bloodshed on the cross of Jesus Christ. The white means chastity and purity. The red cross is a symbol of the Christian religion.

trinidad-and-tobago.name: Trinidad and Tobago
trinidad-and-tobago.description: The flag is formed by two red triangles, with two white stripes and a black band dividing the flag in a diagonal line. The red speaks for the sympathy of the population and denotes the sunshine. The black band corresponds to the determination and for the will for a union. The two white stripes are for justice and the water of the sea.

tunisia.name: Tunisia
tunisia.description: The flag consists of a red background with a white circle in the middle and in the inside is a crescent moon and a star. The red colour stands for the martyrs who sacrifice themselves in the triumph of the Ottoman Empire. The white circle is an illustration of the Sun. Inner in the figure there is a crescent moon and a star is symbols used to represent the Islamic religion.

turkey.name: Turkey
turkey.description: There is a legend that talks about the origin of the flag. It says that an Ottoman sultan observed a blood-colored lake for dead Turks and the crescent moon and a star was reflected in its waters. The moon can also refer to the hunting goddess that these people worshiped long ago.

turkmenistan.name: Turkmenistan
turkmenistan.description: The flag consists of an emerald green background with a leftmost rectangle and a crescent white moon with five white stars. The rectangle is an illustration of a tapestry from the culture and has been used for over two thousand years. The crescent moon represents an Islamic religion and the stars represent the territories of the country: Lebap, Mary, Dasoguz, Ahal and Balkan.

tuvalu.name: Tuvalu
tuvalu.description: The light blue background is a symbol of the Pacific Ocean. The nine stars are an illustration of the nine archipelagos that form the country's territory. In the upper left corner, there is a representation of the flag of the United Kingdom as a tribute to its colonization.

uganda.name: Uganda
uganda.description: The banner is formed by six stripes with a white circle in the middle and in the inside of the circle there is a crowned crane. The colours in the stripes are black, yellow and red and each one has a unique meaning. The black is for the African people. The yellow stands for the strength of the sun and red expresses the message that all Africans are connected by blood. The crowned crane is known for its almost always gentle attitude and has been used to represent the country before.

ukraine.name: Ukraine
ukraine.description: The flag is divided into two horizontal halves and has two colours that make it up: blue at the top and yellow at the bottom. The first blue band assumes the role of harmony and the skies and the yellow colour stands for the wheat fields, also referring to abundance.

united-arab-emirates.name: United Arab Emirates
united-arab-emirates.description: The flag is composed of the Pan-Arabic colours: green, white and black, that represent the unity and friendship that the Arab countries possessed between each other. Although the pan-Arabic colours have no meaning beyond union, the country assigns their own meanings to each one. For the UAE, the green is abundance, the white stands for justice and the black colour speaks for oil in the country.

united-kingdom.name: United kingdom
united-kingdom.description: The flag is a mixture of all the flags of the countries that are part of the United Kingdom: Northern Ireland, Wales, Scotland and England. The flag has three colours: blue, red and white. There are also two types of crosses in the banner: The cross in the form of "X" are the crosses of St. Andrew (Scotland) and St. Patrick (Ireland). The cross in the foreground is the cross of St. George.

united-states.name: United States
united-states.description: The flag has three colours: red, white and blue. The red expresses the resistance of the country and their values. The white stands for chastity and the blue is for equality and hope. The thirteen stripes allude to the thirteen territories that formed the country. The fifty white stars correspond to all the states of the country.

uruguay.name: Uruguay
uruguay.description: The colours blue and white originate from the flags of the provinces of Rio de la Plata and a possible meaning is that these colours express harmony and the sky. The nine stripes stand for the nine cities that composed the country. The sun in the upper left corner is the May Sun and represents the May revolution that took place on May 17, 1810, which was one of the first steps towards Uruguay's independence.

uzbekistan.name: Uzbekistan
uzbekistan.description: The light blue on the first band stands for the skies and the white represents fairness. The stripes in red express unity, harmony and resistance. The green colour exhibits the kindness of the people towards each other and outsiders. The crescent white moon is a symbol of innovation and freedom but can also symbolise the religion of most of the population in the country. The twelve stars correspond to the twelve Uzbekistan’s provinces.

vanuatu.name: Vanuatu
vanuatu.description: The red on top stands for the blood of those who fought for the country. The yellow “Y” is an illustration of the territory of the country. The green colour represents the great vegetation of Vanuatu. The boar tooth alludes to the richness of the region and the two golden leaves symbolize harmony.

vatican-city.name: Vatican City
vatican-city.description: The flag is divided into two vertical halves, one yellow and the other white. On the white part, there is a figure of two keys, one golden and the other silver, which denotes the keys of heaven that Saint Peter possessed. The triple crown is a representation of the sacred functions of the high priest, supreme pastor and supreme teacher.

venezuela.name: Venezuela
venezuela.description: The flag has three colours and is divided into three bands with a semi-circle made up of eight white stars. The yellow corresponds to the beauty of the country's fauna and flora. Blue is for the Atlantic Ocean and the red colour stands for the blood spilled in the struggles that sought independence for Venezuela. Of the eight stars of the semicircle, seven represent the provinces that existed at the time of independence (1811). The last star personifies Simon Bolívar, one of the figures that contributed a lot for Venezuela to gain its freedom.

vietnam.name: Vietnam
vietnam.description: The flag is formed by a red background with a centred yellow star. The flag was created with the purpose of serving as an image in the fight against the dominance of France in the country, but as the Vietnamese lost to France, the artist of the flag had his hands cut. The flag was only officially adopted in 1955, but only by the north of the country. Only in 1976 did the southern region of Vietnam achieve independence and adopt the flag.

wales.name: Wales
wales.description: This is one of the only flags in the world that features a dragon on its flag. The background is filled with white and green colours that refer to the royal family, Tudor. But the colour green also means the food leek, a national symbol of the country. The red dragon in front represents the protection of the royal family and its territory.

western-sahara.name: Western Sahara
western-sahara.description: The flag is composed by three equals bands with a red triangle at the base and an illustration of a crescent moon with a star. The colours red, black, white and green are pan-Arabic colours that were originated by the flag used in the Arab Uprising flag. The red crescent moon and the red star are iconic symbols of Islam, as well as the colour green.

yemen.name: Yemen
yemen.description: The flag is separated into three equal stripes. The first red band stands for the martyrs who died for the country, harmony among their people and fearlessness. The white colour expresses the feeling of hope for progress in the future and the black alludes to the mistakes in the country's past.

zambia.name: Zambia
zambia.description: The green background of the flag alludes to the country’s flora. There is also a rectangle in the lower right corner divided into three bands in the colours of red, black and orange with an eagle on top. The red colour represents the struggle that the country went through and overcame to have its independence. The black stripe stands for the population of the country and the orange colour is a symbol of the country's mineral wealth. The eagle connotes the resistance, both emotional and physical, of the people of the country who managed to overcome everything that happened in the country.

zimbabwe.name: Zimbabwe
zimbabwe.description: The flag consists of a white triangle that means unity and friendship, a bird, a red star and six stripes coming from the triangle. The bird is a symbol of the culture and dates to the time of the country's origin. The red star below the bird refers to the struggle for  Zimbabwe's independence. The first green band alludes to farmland and farms while the yellow symbolises the earth's riches in minerals. The red colour stands for the blood of those who fought for the free will in the Chimurenga (wars). The black band speaks for the country's population, who are mostly Africans, and their culture.
